verses.text: Then \w Job|strong="H0347"\w* \w answered|strong="H6030"\w* and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*,

I \w know|strong="H3045"\w* \add it is\add* so of a \w truth|strong="H0551"\w*: but how should \w man|strong="H0582"\w* be \w just|strong="H6663"\w* with \w God|strong="H0410"\w*?\f + \fr 9.2 \ft with God: or, before God?\f*
If he \w will|strong="H2654"\w* \w contend|strong="H7378"\w* with him, he cannot \w answer|strong="H6030"\w* him \w one|strong="H0259"\w* of a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w*.

\add He is\add* \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* in \w heart|strong="H3824"\w*, and \w mighty|strong="H0533"\w* in \w strength|strong="H3581"\w*: who hath \w hardened|strong="H7185"\w* \add himself\add* against him, and hath \w prospered|strong="H7999"\w*?
Which \w removeth|strong="H6275"\w* the \w mountains|strong="H2022"\w*, and they \w know|strong="H3045"\w* not: which \w overturneth|strong="H2015"\w* them in his \w anger|strong="H0639"\w*.
Which \w shaketh|strong="H7264"\w* the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w* out of her \w place|strong="H4725"\w*, and the \w pillars|strong="H5982"\w* thereof \w tremble|strong="H6426"\w*.
Which \w commandeth|strong="H0559"\w* the \w sun|strong="H2775"\w*, and it \w riseth|strong="H2224"\w* not; and sealeth \w up|strong="H2856"\w* the \w stars|strong="H3556"\w*.

Which alone spreadeth \w out|strong="H5186"\w* the \w heavens|strong="H8064"\w*, and \w treadeth|strong="H1869"\w* upon the \w waves|strong="H1116"\w* of the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*.\f + \fr 9.8 \ft waves: Heb. heights\f*

Which \w maketh|strong="H6213"\w* \w Arcturus|strong="H5906"\w*, \w Orion|strong="H3685"\w*, and \w Pleiades|strong="H3598"\w*, and the \w chambers|strong="H2315"\w* of the \w south|strong="H8486"\w*.\f + \fr 9.9 \ft Arcturus…: Heb. Ash, Cesil, and Cimah\f*

Which \w doeth|strong="H6213"\w* great \w things|strong="H1419"\w* \w past|strong="H0369"\w* finding \w out|strong="H2714"\w*; yea, and \w wonders|strong="H6381"\w* without \w number|strong="H4557"\w*.
Lo, he \w goeth|strong="H5674"\w* by me, and I \w see|strong="H7200"\w* \add him\add* not: he passeth \w on|strong="H2498"\w* also, but I \w perceive|strong="H0995"\w* him not.

Behold, he taketh \w away|strong="H2862"\w*, who can \w hinder|strong="H7725"\w* him? who will \w say|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, What \w doest|strong="H6213"\w* thou?\f + \fr 9.12 \ft hinder…: Heb. turn him away?\f*

\add If\add* \w God|strong="H0433"\w* will not \w withdraw|strong="H7725"\w* his \w anger|strong="H0639"\w*, the \w proud|strong="H7293"\w* \w helpers|strong="H5826"\w* do \w stoop|strong="H7817"\w* under him.\f + \fr 9.13 \ft proud…: Heb. helpers of pride, or, strength\f*
How much less shall I \w answer|strong="H6030"\w* him, \add and\add* choose \w out|strong="H0977"\w* my \w words|strong="H1697"\w* \add to reason\add* with him?

Whom, though I were \w righteous|strong="H6663"\w*, \add yet\add* would I not \w answer|strong="H6030"\w*, \add but\add* I would make \w supplication|strong="H2603"\w* to my \w judge|strong="H8199"\w*.

If I had \w called|strong="H7121"\w*, and he had \w answered|strong="H6030"\w* me; \add yet\add* would I not \w believe|strong="H0539"\w* that he had \w hearkened|strong="H0238"\w* unto my \w voice|strong="H6963"\w*.
For he \w breaketh|strong="H7779"\w* me with a \w tempest|strong="H8183"\w*, and \w multiplieth|strong="H7235"\w* my \w wounds|strong="H6482"\w* without \w cause|strong="H2600"\w*.
He will not \w suffer|strong="H5414"\w* me to \w take|strong="H7725"\w* my \w breath|strong="H7307"\w*, but \w filleth|strong="H7646"\w* me with \w bitterness|strong="H4472"\w*.

If \add I speak\add* of \w strength|strong="H3581"\w*, lo, \add he is\add* \w strong|strong="H0533"\w*: and if of \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w*, who shall \w set|strong="H3259"\w* me a time \add to plead\add*?

If I \w justify|strong="H6663"\w* myself, mine own \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w* shall \w condemn|strong="H7561"\w* me: \add if I say\add*, I \add am\add* \w perfect|strong="H8535"\w*, it shall also prove me \w perverse|strong="H6140"\w*.

\add Though\add* I \add were\add* \w perfect|strong="H8535"\w*, \add yet\add* would I not \w know|strong="H3045"\w* my \w soul|strong="H5315"\w*: I would \w despise|strong="H3988"\w* my \w life|strong="H2416"\w*.

This \add is\add* \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \add thing\add*, therefore I \w said|strong="H0559"\w* \add it\add*, He \w destroyeth|strong="H3615"\w* the \w perfect|strong="H8535"\w* and the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w*.
If the \w scourge|strong="H7752"\w* \w slay|strong="H4191"\w* \w suddenly|strong="H6597"\w*, he will \w laugh|strong="H3932"\w* at the \w trial|strong="H4531"\w* of the \w innocent|strong="H5355"\w*.

The \w earth|strong="H0776"\w* is \w given|strong="H5414"\w* into the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w*: he \w covereth|strong="H3680"\w* the \w faces|strong="H6440"\w* of the \w judges|strong="H8199"\w* thereof; if not, \w where|strong="H0645"\w*, \add and\add* who \add is\add* he?
Now my \w days|strong="H3117"\w* are \w swifter|strong="H7043"\w* than a \w post|strong="H7323"\w*: they flee \w away|strong="H1272"\w*, they \w see|strong="H7200"\w* no \w good|strong="H2896"\w*.

They are passed \w away|strong="H2498"\w* \w as|strong="H5973"\w* the \w swift|strong="H0016"\w* \w ships|strong="H0591"\w*: as the \w eagle|strong="H5404"\w* \add that\add* \w hasteth|strong="H2907"\w* to the \w prey|strong="H0400"\w*.\f + \fr 9.26 \ft swift…: or, ships of Ebeh: Heb. ships of desire\f*

If I \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, I will \w forget|strong="H7911"\w* my \w complaint|strong="H7879"\w*, I will leave \w off|strong="H5800"\w* my \w heaviness|strong="H6440"\w*, and \w comfort|strong="H1082"\w* \add myself:\add*
I am \w afraid|strong="H3025"\w* of all my \w sorrows|strong="H6094"\w*, I \w know|strong="H3045"\w* that thou wilt not hold me \w innocent|strong="H5352"\w*.
\add If\add* I be \w wicked|strong="H7561"\w*, why then \w labour|strong="H3021"\w* I in \w vain|strong="H1892"\w*?
If I \w wash|strong="H7364"\w* myself \w with|strong="H7950"\w* snow \w water|strong="H4325"\w*, and make my \w hands|strong="H3709"\w* \w never|strong="H1252"\w* so \w clean|strong="H2141"\w*;

\w Yet|strong="H0227"\w* shalt thou \w plunge|strong="H2881"\w* me in the \w ditch|strong="H7845"\w*, and mine own \w clothes|strong="H8008"\w* shall \w abhor|strong="H8581"\w* me.\f + \fr 9.31 \ft abhor…: or, make me to be abhorred\f*

For \add he is\add* not a \w man|strong="H0376"\w*, as I \add am, that\add* I should \w answer|strong="H6030"\w* him, \add and\add* we should \w come|strong="H0935"\w* \w together|strong="H3162"\w* in \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w*.

Neither \w is|strong="H3426"\w* there any \w daysman|strong="H3198"\w* betwixt us, \add that\add* might \w lay|strong="H7896"\w* his \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* upon us \w both|strong="H8147"\w*.\f + \fr 9.33 \ft any…: Heb. one that should argue\f*\f + \fr 9.33 \ft daysman: or, umpire\f*
Let him \w take|strong="H5493"\w* his \w rod|strong="H7626"\w* \w away|strong="H5493"\w* from me, and let not his \w fear|strong="H0367"\w* \w terrify|strong="H1204"\w* me:
\add Then\add* would I \w speak|strong="H1696"\w*, and not \w fear|strong="H3372"\w* him; but \add it is\add* not so with me.\f + \fr 9.35 \ft it is…: Heb. I am not so with myself\f*
